Takano-san with my little kogatana got me 
to introduce a reverse curve  so it ended up straight(ish) after 
yake-ire. I can imagine a Tachi many  times the size of my effort curving 
significantly.

I bet the  quenching was a hoot :-)>
 
Oh it was that..more like a screech owl though...It was moaning, groaning  
and doing the shimmy-shake. I thought I was just going to holding onto the  
nakago after it was all said and done.
 
Now when you harden you expect  to get some sori but this was  extreme. 
Looking at the blade I have enough "meat" at the kissaki to do a nicer  kissaki 
and yokote so I am going to change the tip geometry from shobu  to shinogi, 
I left this one a bit thick as I didn't know what was going to  happen 
during yaki-ire and this may be one reason why the sori got so  extreme... The 
ha was my usual just under a "penny thickness"...any thinner and  I get 
cracks.....
 
I tell ya this one has me stumped as to why the sori is so extreme...
 
JPH
